line_1: But this Misfortune you too oft condole,
line_2: Whilst loosest Thoughts debauch your willing Soul

line_1: Together they are left, each to condole,
line_2: That by dividing Grief, neither may bear the Whole.

line_1: Thus Sickness which my Mourning Friends condole
line_2: When Art could not restore my Body whole,

line_1: Thus Sickness which my Mourning Friends condole
line_2: Prov'd the Divine Physitian of my Soul.

line_1: 'Tis sure, the Publick Loss thou dost condole;
line_2: 'Tis that which yet lies pressing on thy Soul.
